ISSUE.TITLE: Containers stop if dependency gets updated
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description I have two podman-systemd containers: - [photoprism](https://github.com/M1cha/homeserver/blob/8952888b45fb28016aa9561f86b4c2bdc98ada40/files/containers/photoprism.container#L1) - [photoprism-mariadb](https://github.com/M1cha/homeserver/blob/8952888b45fb28016aa9561f86b4c2bdc98ada40/files/containers/bitwarden-mariadb.container#LL1C1-L1C1) They both have: - auto start enabled using `default.target` - auto restart enabled using `Restart=always` - auto update enabled using `Label=io.containers.autoupdate=registry` photoprism depends on photoprism-mariadb due to: ``` After=network.target photoprism-mariadb.service Requires=photoprism-mariadb.service ``` Now, whenever photoprism-mariadb.service gets restarted because it was updated by `podman-auto-update.service`, `photoprism` stops until I start it manually. If I run `systemctl restart photoprism-mariadb`, `photoprism` will stop as well, but restart after 10 seconds as expected. ### Steps to reproduce the issue Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Create two containers in the given config 2. BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #18828 from rhatdan/quadlet quadlet should exit non zero on failures

COMMIT.MESSAGE: auto update: restart instead of stop+start Commit f131eaa74aa6 changed restart to a stop+start motivated by comments in the systemd man pages that restart behaves different than stop+start, for instance, that it keeps certain resources open and treats timers differently. Yet, the actually fix for #17607 in the very same commit was dealing with an ENOENT of the CID file on container removal. As it turns out in in #18926, changing to stop+start regressed on restarting dependencies when auto updating a systemd unit. Hence, move back to using restart to make sure that dependent systemd units are restarted as well. An alternative could be recommending to use `BindsTo=` in Quadlet files but this seems less common than `Requires=` and hence more risky to cause issues on user sites. Fixes: #18926 Signed-off-by: Valentin Rothberg <vrothberg@redhat.com>
